summary: I am a data scientist and Artificial Intelligence researcher. I am a driven person who focuses on results and believes in teamwork as fuel for generating great advancements. I have used Machine Learning and Probability theory for modeling and predicting the states of dynamical systems. Data driven models based on deep learning and state estimation on multisensory data are relevant topics of my daily work. I have also served as evaluator of international peer-review congresses and judge at IEEE international events such as the IEEE Signal Processing Cup 2020 (SP Cup 2020).

awards.title: Best poster award at ISIF Summer School on Signal Processing
awards.description: We have participated with a work based on the scientific article entitled "Prediction of Multi-target Dynamics Using Discrete Descriptors: an Interactive Approach", which proposes a probabilistic framework to model/capture the causal relationships between the states of different agents that dynamically evolve/interact during the time.

awards.title: Best Demo runner up at GTTI Thematic Meeting 2018 on Multimedia Signal Processing
awards.description: We have participated with a work based on the scientific article entitled "Learning Multi-Modal Self-Awareness Models for Autonomous Vehicles from Human Driving", which analyzes video and odometry information from a vehicle through the usage of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and Bayesian inferences.
awards.issuer: IEEE Signal Processing Society - Italian Chapter

authors.headline: Data Scientist at ASML

Working for Humans, thinking from Science. 
Prof. Universidad EAFIT
Postdoctoral researcher

profile_positions.description: I have applied different machine learning techniques to discover patterns in multi-sensory data, facilitating the generation of predictive models of multimodal information under a Bayesian framework. My main work has been focused on the analysis of multi-sensory vehicle information, including GPS, control, and first-person visual information. Methods based on traditional machine learning techniques and deep learning algorithms have been accepted in international journals such as the IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems in 2019 and 2020.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: My PhD focused on the analysis of trajectory data from different sources, e.g., GPS or video information. During my PhD I have used several machine learning techniques for learning relationships between dynamical variables and filtering techniques for predicting and tracking future data. The title of my thesis is ''Modeling and characterization of individuals’ dynamics based on an environment-agent interactive approach''
profile_positions.title: PhD

profile_positions.description: Generation of machine learning models to understand emotional content in audio/speech signals.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant
